CatDescriptText: Ruby Winstead, hospital worker, 107 13th Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 30, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think single or married women make better teachers for elementary grades in public schools?  Do you think that married men should teach in elementary grades?" answer reads: "The single woman, in my opinion, will make the better teacher.  The reason--why because they don't have any responsibilities which would keep them from having their mind on their work.  I am undecided about whether or not men should teach in elementary school."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ruby Winstead wearing eyeglasses, striped blouse, and wristwatch on left wrist, standing on Liberty Avenue, May Building with Thrift Drugs in background
